elements.title: Vincent de Groof
elements.contents: ... that Vincent de Groof successfully tested his bat-like flying machine (pictured) in 1874, only to die after crashing it 10 days later?

elements.title: a play about sex offenders
elements.contents: ... that the theatre which premiered a play about sex offenders had to hire additional security for its run?

elements.title: Xing Xing
elements.contents: ... that visitors from various countries come to a temple to see a wild Chinese monkey named Xing Xing?

elements.title: Fatima Hassouna
elements.contents: ... that Fatima Hassouna was killed shortly after a documentary about her was announced for the 2025 Cannes Film Festival?

elements.title: his debut album
elements.contents: ... that at a Destroy Lonely concert promoting an edition of his debut album, some fans entered his car?

elements.title: Carl Jorgensen
elements.contents: ... that Carl Jorgensen and Gust Zarnas were the first NFL players from Denmark and Greece?

elements.title: in silence, accompanied only by the sound of muffled drums
elements.contents: ... that in 1917 more than 8,000 African Americans protested lynchings by marching down New York City's Fifth Avenue in silence, accompanied only by the sound of muffled drums?

elements.title: a Sicilian soldier
elements.contents: ... that a Sicilian soldier killed his own family during an Ottoman attack on Gozo in 1551, to prevent them from being enslaved?

elements.title: Costa Rica's most famous bull
elements.contents: ... that Costa Rica's most famous bull killed two men and loved mangos?
